info.author: Sean Kelly
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: Apache Software License
Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
***************
edrnsite.vanity
***************

This package allows EDRN_ members to create their own vanity pages, showing
off their portraits, biomarkers they work on, publications they've made, etc.
It was developed by the EDRN Informatics Center (IC_) at the Jet Propulsion
Laboratory (JPL_).

.. References:
.. _EDRN: http://edrn.nci.nih.gov/
.. _IC: http://cancer.jpl.nasa.gov/
.. _JPL: http://www.jpl.nasa.gov/


Installation
============

Use zc.buildout and the plone.recipe.zope2instance recipe to manage your
project, adding this package as an egg.  You don't need a ZCML slug because it
uses z3c.autoinclude.plugin with the Plone target.


Changelog
=========

What follows is a log of changes from release to release.  Where issue
identifiers appear, you can find more about them by visiting this project's
issue tracker at https://oodt.jpl.nasa.gov/jira/browse/CA.


1.0.6 — Plone 4.3.9 Upgrade
---------------------------

• CA-1592


1.0.5 — You're Not That Vain
----------------------------

• CA-1493 - Bespoke pages should show protocols, then biomarkers and datasets
• CA-1498 - Disable vanity pages


1.0.4 — You're So Vain
----------------------

• Finally a functioning bespoke page!


1.0.3 — I Had Some Chicken; Pass Me the FLOSS
---------------------------------------------

• First official release as free/libre/open source software.


1.0.2 — Upgrades
----------------

• Compatibility with Zope 2.13.20.


1.0.1 — More Flesh
------------------

• Additional attributes on bespoke pages: email, phone, EDRN title, specialty
• Control panel to enable/disable vanity page creation, nagging
• Make vanity pages compatible with Members List


1.0.0 — FCS
-----------

• First customer ship
• CA-1078 - Access to Vanity Pages


0.0.0 — Unreleased
------------------

Initial, unreleased release.
info.keywords: rdf web zope plone cancer bioinformatics detection informatics edrn personal
